Reviews.Title: Directed Electronics 8600 Micro Magnetic Switch
Reviews.Author: B. Brooks
Reviews.Content: I used this with some strip lighting for my safe. Looks and feels will made. Really not much else to say, it is what it is.I'll explain how this one works.*When the 2 magnets are together, the contacts are open (means the current is stopped)*When the 2 magnets are apart, the contacts are closed (meaning the current is running)Like a light switch on the wall, the magnetic switch does the samething but using the magnet to do the switching.Hope that helps

Reviews.Title: Magnetic switch
Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: I used this product for my safe... I used rope light inside to light it and wanted the lights to come on when the door opened for quick access... the switch works great...make sure to wire it to DC current only! I gave it four stars because the first one that came did not work...Amazon made good and sent me a new one at no charge with two day shipping...so I would give Amazon 5 stars on service.

Reviews.Title: I Really Like These!
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Bought two and they both work great!  Used to switch off LED strips in cabinets when the doors are shut.  They are small and the tape holds them firmly.  Just make sure you wipe the surface you want to stick these to with alcohol, otherwise they might become loose.Also make sure that your 12V DC transformer is sized correctly to the wattage of your lights, or whatever you want to power.  Not sure how many watts these switches can handle but I'm not over 10 watts.Also note that these work in any orientation.  I have a set from another manufacturer (which I paid double the amount as these) and they only work when lined up one way (polarity).  I had to apply a small block of wood to the cabinet frame so they could align correctly.The product description says dimensions are 3.1 x 8 x 5 inches.  That might be the box size.  The magnet is 1.125" long x 0.375".Just ordered two more.  These are an awesome way to light a dark cabinet.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Katelyn Campbell
Reviews.Content: I put this on the door to my gun safe.  My LED lights turn on when the door is open and turn off when the door is closed.  I did go to Lowes and pick up a bigger magnet which makes it easier to line up the connection.  The magnet on the swing door does not need to be the one provided in the kit FYI.  I would buy again!!

Reviews.Title: Do not buy
Reviews.Author: James T. Owen
Reviews.Content: failed on first tried! Do not try! will not work with 12v system! Will only work 1 time then will not work again.

Reviews.Title: Broke on me
Reviews.Author: MasterZZ
Reviews.Content: After a couple uses the thing broke on me (not sure what happened- if it lost its magnification or what but the circuit would not open and close any more).

Reviews.Title: magnetic switch
Reviews.Author: M. Michulka "SGT Hulka"
Reviews.Content: used this to activate a LED strip in an enclosure.  I wanted it to turn on when the door opened and turn off when the door was closed.  Worked great with my 12v 5m LED strip.  Glue on back of magnets is very strong so be sure you know where you want to place it before you remove the protective tape.

Reviews.Title: Just Right
Reviews.Author: Dale in Tenn "Dale"
Reviews.Content: These work perfectly for my security application (garage doors).  Not much to say other than the fact that these are the right side and appear that they will provide long periods of service.

Reviews.Title: Light, small, works!
Reviews.Author: Shaunspad
Reviews.Content: I used this switch to install my truck bed lights and I didn't want to drill a bunch of wholes and or use a mechanical switch so I purchased this and it works great.

Reviews.Title: Reliable
Reviews.Author: Skoot61
Reviews.Content: This switch works great on my safe door to activate the LED light strips... I found out that the local Radio Shack stores don't carry these in the stores with everything being wireless these days.  Glad it was still available online.

Reviews.Title: Handy little device
Reviews.Author: Alec T. "Alec T."
Reviews.Content: Used this switch to retrofit a pantry closet to turn LED strip tape on whenever the door was opened. It's very convenient - both sides come with foam mounting tape, which is sufficient (I didn't use the screw-hole flanges at all), and the two sides work in basically any orientation with each other. The normally-open switch closes when the two sides are a couple inches apart, which in my installation, when mounted to the hinge-side of the door, equated to the door being opened about 9". The wire is nice and long; I ended up cutting it much shorter to fit my purposes.The one downside is the leads are 24 AWG, so this is definitely a low-power device switch only.I'm not sure about its reliability and number of duty cycles, but it seems of decent construction and for a pantry closet door I expect it to last a long time.

Reviews.Title: Good security switch
Reviews.Author: tdinardo
Reviews.Content: Very small and accurate. If you need an alarm switch or an external switch for a zwave sensor, this one works well.

Reviews.Title: One worked, one didn't
Reviews.Author: StevieT
Reviews.Content: Easy to wire up, connect the negative of your light to the switch and the negative of your transformer to the switch.  Then connect the positive wire of your light to the positive wire of your transformer.I purchased 2 of these.  One worked fine, the other is DOA, does not work at all.  Guess I will try my luck on another.

Reviews.Title: Best money ever spent
Reviews.Author: Rell 7
Reviews.Content: this is exactly what i was looing for i used it to replace the push pin sensor on my car alarm which would rust and no longer function. i have been using this product for my application for many months now and it couldnt be working better. dont hessitate to buy you wont be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: Great little switch
Reviews.Author: Chad Skidmore
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these to use on my RV trailer. I put one on each door into the storage area on the RV to turn on some LED strip lights. The switch is pretty small and compact and the magnet is strong enough that it will open the circuit with the two pieces being a little ways apart. This worked well in my application. So far the adhesive on them is working well but there are also holes to screw them into place if needed. Note that there are no screws included with them.

Reviews.Title: After 6 months switch started sticking
Reviews.Author: txrose
Reviews.Content: Using it to turn on Hit Light LED strip after 6 months or so started sticking in the open position so lights will not come on when I open the door without giving the switch a good thump.

Reviews.Title: truely smaller size.
Reviews.Author: C. McKay "I should be fishing...."
Reviews.Content: worked great.  These are smaller in size so if a lower profile is what you are after these may do the trick. They have a long (22 guage?) wire attached. Do make sure you understand normally open vs closed. These are normally closed menaing the switch closes when the magnet is away. In my case closed door - light off, open door light on.I ultimtimately went with another item as I was using in a marine enviornment and needed lager gauge and marine wire.

Reviews.Title: did not work out of the box
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: Got this to work as a door switch for LED lights.  Could not get it to work.  Continuity check indicates that switch is open regardless of whether the opposing magnet is touching it or not.  Will try to return it, but cost of shipping it back may be more than it is worth.

Reviews.Title: Too fragile, shorts will fuse switch in place
Reviews.Author: Tman
Reviews.Content: I was using these to make cabinet lights - so when you open the door, the led lights would come on.They work as intended (Normally Closed means that electricity will flow when the magnet is far away) but I've had 2 of these ruin because of a short occurring after I was sodering the leads to the LED strip. The switch is now in the ALWAYS on - meaning that the magnet has no effect, thus ruining the entire configuration.The LED strip I was sodering it to was 15" long, so very minimal amount of current flowing through.Buyer beware - if you are a good soderer, and you can somehow protect the leads, the product will work as advertised, but any problems and you just through $8 down the drain. (I'm counting S&H; as part of the price)

Reviews.Title: Magnetic switch without the magnet to activate it.
Reviews.Author: z.armstrong
Reviews.Content: The magnetic switch didn't come with a magnet. ??????????????? I thought it was supposed to. It is usless to me. In the picture it has the magnet with it????????????????

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: stacy mcclain
Reviews.Content: Intended usage: Gun cabinet LED light switch. This switch/switches lasted 7 tries before failure occurred. Intended VT/Watt spec of system, 12/24. This switch looked like it had promise at first, both switches were very sensitive, meaning, would open the circuit at a gap of 1 inch or less and close at gap larger then 1.5, but before permanent installation tried 7 times on each of the two units and both failed at 7 or fewer cycles. These switches may be useful in a circuit utilizing a milliamp relay but feel anything higher then just milliamps will burn the contacts, and for use inside a safe where you cant tell if the lights go out would be devastating. Just dont waist your money if using in a high watt/amp draw circuit like I did.
